Build ID: I20070608-1718

Steps To Reproduce:
1.  Select a row
2.  Right-click with a context menu action or some other way to trigger an action that will remove a column.  Be sure to make sure the entire row is selected.
3.  Perform the action and an iob exception occurs.


More information:
in the removeColumn() method it removes the column , then updateColumnSelection() and in there causes an index out of bounds exception because the column no longer exists

the offending call in updateColumnSelection(): 
GridColumn col = getColumn(cell.x);

By then it is too late , the column previously got removed in the removeColumn() call

Hi Mike,

I cannot reproduce this.  There is code in removeColumn() that specifically removes all cells from the removed column from the selection list.  I created a quick snippet just to verify and it worked correctly.  Can you provide the exact stack trace?  The lines you indicate shouldn't ever throw an IOB.  Also, if you provide a snippet that reproduces the problem I should be able to solve it asap.  Please see the SWT snippet pages to see what I mean:
http://www.eclipse.org/swt/snippets/

I need a small class that I can run, free from any supporting code that I do not have access to.  

Thanks,
-Chris

Hi Chris

I am facing the same problem of indexOutOfBound exception when i try to remove a Column and one row is fully selected.

I am including the stack trace as requested by you ... 

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Index out of bounds
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3547)

To reproduce the error follow the same steps as mentioned by Mike.

I've been able to reproduce this bug. The following conditions must be true for the IOB exception to be thrown. 

1. Have cell selection enabled.
2. Have at least one column to the right of the column being removed
3. Select a cell in both the column being removed and a column on the right

Created an attachment (id=75342)
fix defect

Attached that will fix the defect. The problem was that the selected cells needed to update their column index values to reflect the removed column.
